page.title: 18FUND RAISING IN S. HUTTON
page.content: Village hall-using the Richard III connection a"Richard III Fair" was held for three years,the last in 1984,villagers dressing in mediaeval costume,with stalls,side shows and craft demonstrations held in and around the castle ruins and on the village green.Coffee mornings, sponsored long distance walks(50-60 people involved),auctions,flower stall and on Guy Fawkes night,with a large bonfire burning on the village green,sales of hot dogs,soup,jacket potatoes,all go to the village hall funds.Church and Chapel have also needed money in recent years-Church favouring flower festivals and craft exhibitions,garden parties,barn dances,bring and buy stalls while Chapel used walks,cake stalls,car boot sales,safari supper,fashion shows and make up demonstrations.
